Articles.Content:
Floor 4519: a cable and internet provider that has become unreliable and is currently in its 9th hour of total service blackout

090701252024

new page

Edited January 25 by AlamoVampire

Floor 4520: Logarithmic functions. In the middle of it all is a math nerd who insists on writing 2 as log base 2 of 4. This allows him to nest the log within itself since it defines and contains the number 2 at the same time.

Floor 4521: The greatest music library ever. Every song and music recorded on individual pure vinyl, in a storage system that stretches for hundreds of miles. With an interface that you can use to call up whatever you want and have it played through speakers built into to very comfortable listening chairs. You may be here a while.

You start with "Bow River" by "Cold Chisel".

Floor 4522: your favorite band/solo artist singing/performing your least favorite band/solo artists music

061801272024
Floor 4523: This room is filled with forum users, sitting in front of computers. None can see the others, but all are trying to come up with fun reasons to ban each other.

Floor 4524: A walking bacteriophage on the surface of Minmus. You don't know how it got there or what it does, but it looks like someone spent hours setting up Kal controllers so it could walk in any direction.

Floor 4525: baked potatoes

022901282024
Floor 4526: A detailed model showing all 93 missing floors of the building. You look carefully to try and see some of what you missed out on.
Floor 4527: gigantic food court. Every restaurant ever made is here, and you see people from various ages chatting, eating, and stuff.

Floor 4528: a single metronome pulsing at 30 beats a minute where every so often one of the pulses is an ear piercing tone. Its completely random

132201292024
Floor 4529: The entire parts list from KSP1 and 2, in real life.

Floor 4530: a carrot, a purple carrot. 

193301292024
Floor 4531: The VAB from KSP1. Suddenly, one of the wall panels falls and you see an entire orchestra behind the walls playing a constant stream of music for the engineers scurrying around.

Floor 4532: An endless labyrinth of drywall, occasionally interupted by a window which seems to lead to floor 4515. There are white wooden doors that swing off of a wall, with no opening behind them. There are trapdoors on the ceiling which are dusty and seem to lead to other floors, most commonly floor 3233. The air is dusty, and hasn't been cleaned in a while. Occasianally, one may stumble across the remains of food, strange liquids, and/or plastic shards. 

Where are you?

In fact, how did you get here?

Is there a way out?

Are the attics safe?

Can I climb higher?

There's no point in turning back; quite frankly, you've forgot how to leave.

The building does that to you.

Floor 4533: You recognize this place as the backrooms. However, what makes it even worse is not the fact that you are being hunted, but the fact that there is nothing here. Infinity, filled with absolutely nothing meaningful in any way, and you are alone here, in a mind-numbingly boring sequence of never-repeating, but never-interesting rooms.

@ColdJ, how many floors are we off by? Should we correct this or no?

Floor 4534: A giant round table with players discussing various threads.

 

( @Kimera Industries. someone jumped from floor 2099 to floor 3000 in the same post on page 76, which I believe would have thrown things off by 901 floors, but by doing the simple 25 posts per page times number of pages I think we are currently off by 93 (not sure I got it right, feel free to check me on this.) I think it would be too disruptive to reset the current floor numbers, but if players agree to it, maybe we could write a floor and include in the same post a different floor marked as a random reminicense. Numbered till we do 93 of them, but not actually put a floor number. What do you think?)

(To make it even more confusing, a forum user who no longer exists seems to have purposely dropped the count back by 3000 floors on page 91 and again people didn't take proper notice. If someone is bored enough to go through every single page we might find out all that has happened but I couldn't be bothered trying to sort it all out.)

Edited January 30 by ColdJ
Floor 4535: a person saying that he might check every page to see how high we should be, I am not sure how long it wil take.

Floor 4536: a sign reading: Ground Floor Welcome to the Building

094301302024
Floor 4537: This floor has 2 exit doors, one says to the next floor. the other says "Roof Exit".

Floor 4538: A room full of chaoticians. They appear to rank themselves by how well they can do the weird laugh Malcom does on the helicopter.

@ColdJ, we'll leave the count as is. I guess it's just in the nature of the building itself to be this way.

Floor 4539

The results

Spoiler

Clarification: I took the last post on a Page and added 25 to it, if the floornumbers were the same I added another 25 until they didn't. 

If they weren't the same I subtracted them and got the difference, if it was negative  the floornumber was to low and if it was positive it was to high.

Total +645 floors to high
 

If this is correct the current floor number should be 4539-645=3894

2 hours ago, WaldeB said:

If this is correct the current floor number should be 4539-645=3894

Some massive errors in there, but did any self correct as we went along I wonder.

Still 25 times 178 would mean the last on this page should be 4450.

Floor 4540: Organised chaos.

Shouldn't it be 1 less because the very first post isn't a floor but the rules and explanation of this game?

 

Floor 4541(/4540)

An organiser struggling to organise the chaos

Edited February 3 by WaldeB

16 hours ago, WaldeB said:

Shouldn't it be 1 less because the very first post isn't a floor but the rules and explanation of this game?

Technically yes. Also the creator started us on floor 0, also known as the ground floor. Either way the first page ended on floor 24.

Floor 4542: The bridge of the USS Zeng He. It reminds you of the bridge of the USS Discovery.
Floor 4543: GLaDOS' boss battle room.
